"If you hear not a deep & heavy bell";
I looked & saw between us & the sun
A building on an island; such a one
As age to age might add, for uses vile,
A windowless, deformed & dreary pile,
hung
And on the top b an open tower where
A bell, which in the radiance swayed &
swung
We could just hear its hoarse & iron tongue.
The broad sun sank behind it, & it tolled
In strong & black relief — "What we behold
Shall be the madhouse & its belfry tower,"
